analysis.title: Data Analysis ğŸ“ˆğŸ“ŠğŸ“
analysis.subtitle: Analyze car data by grouping results based on selected fields such as make, model, year, engine, gearbox, and more.
analysis.groupByText: Select fields to group vehicles data by:
analysis.groupByInstructions: Choose one or more fields from your dataset to group the vehicles data by. Each checkbox represents a different field. For example, you might want to group the data by 'Make' and 'Model' to understand the distribution of vehicles by make and model.
analysis.dataInstructions1: Choose one or more columns from your dataset that you wish to analyze. Each checkbox represents a different column. For example, you might want to analyze the 'Price' or 'Estimated Price' columns to understand their distribution and summary statistics. All prices are in EUR (â‚¬). [Discount] and [Increase] columns are expressed as percentages (e.g., 25%).
analysis.dataInstructions2: All prices are in EUR(â‚¬). [Discount] and [Increase] columns are percentages (for example 25%).
analysis.statFunctionsInstructions: Choose one or more statistical functions to apply to your data. Each function will provide you with a different summary statistic for the selected columns. For example, you might want to calculate the mean, median, and standard deviation of the 'Price' column to understand its distribution and central tendency.

modal.groupingDescription: Selecting the checkboxes above allows you to group the vehicles based on the selected criteria. For example, you can group the vehicles by their make, model, or year of manufacture. This helps you to organize the data and see trends and patterns more clearly.
modal.mileageCategoriesTitle: Specifically for mileage, the vehicles will be grouped into the following categories:
modal.powerCategoriesTitle: Checking the power checkbox, the vehicles will be grouped into the following categories:
modal.statisticsDescription: By grouping vehicles in this way, you can get a statistical overview for each group, such as:
modal.statisticsCountDescription: The total number of vehicles in each group.
modal.statisticsAverageDescription: The average value of a certain attribute (e.g., price) within each group.
modal.statisticsMinMaxDescription: The lowest and highest values within each group.
modal.finalDescription: This statistical overview helps you understand the characteristics of vehicles in each category, making it easier to analyze and make informed decisions.

modal.selectColumnsDescription: Choose one or more columns from your dataset that you wish to analyze. Each checkbox represents a different column. For example, you might want to analyze the 'Price' or 'Estimated Price' columns to understand their distribution and summary statistics.
modal.priceNote: All prices are in EUR(â‚¬). [Discount] and [Increase] columns are percentages (for example 25%).

modal.countDescription: Total number of data points in the selected column.
modal.minDescription: The smallest value in the selected column.
modal.maxDescription: The largest value in the selected column.
modal.averageDescription: The sum of all values divided by the number of values in the selected column.
modal.medianDescription: The middle value when the selected column's values are ordered from smallest to largest.
modal.stdDevDescription: A measure of how spread out the values in the selected column are around the mean.
modal.rsdDescription: The standard deviation expressed as a percentage of the mean, indicating the extent of variability in relation to the mean.
modal.percentileDescription: Values below which a certain percentage of the data in the selected column falls. For example, the 60th percentile is the value below which 60% of the data falls.
